intro: Murdannia malabarica var. compressa, commonly known as the Malabar murdannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Commelinaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and features narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in dense spikes, which bloom during the rainy season. It is native to the Western Ghats of India and thrives in moist, shaded environments. This variant is distinguished by its compressed, cylindrical stems and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions.
